agendaItems.title: File No. PS25-16110 Resolution authorizing a Modification #3 to Subgrant Agreement (Contract Number R0590) between the Florida Division of Emergency Management and the City of Tampa to modify the agreement related to the FY 2022 Urban Area Security Initiative (UASI).
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. PS25-16110 
Resolution authorizing a Modification #3 to Subgrant Agreement (Contract Number R0590) between the Florida Division of Emergency Management and the City of Tampa to modify the agreement related to the FY 2022 Urban Area Security Initiative (UASI); authorizing execution thereof by the Mayor of the City of Tampa and attestation by the City Clerk; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background: The State of Florida division of Emergency Management ("Division") and the City of Tampa ("Recipient") have entered into an Agreement, pursuant to Resolution No. 2022-961 passed and adopted on November 2, 2022 to which the Division has provided a subgrant to the Recipient.  Based upon subsequent events, the parties required to enter in Modification #1 to the subgrant agreement for the purpose of extending the terms to December 31, 2024 pursuant to Resolution No. 2023-513 passed and adopted on June 1, 2023.  The parties were then required to enter into Modification #2 to the subgrant agreement for the purpose of extending the terms to June 30, 2025 pursuant to Resolution No. 2024-667 passed and adopted on August 1, 2024.  The parties now wish to enter into Modification #3 to extend the deadline of the grant to December 31, 2025 with no financial modification.  It is in the best interest enter into Modification #3 and extend the deadline.

agendaItems.title: File No. NCA25-16072 Resolution approving a Cooperative Services Agreement between the City of Tampa, Florida and United States Department of Agriculture to provide wildlife damage management services by removing feral swine in the amount of Thirty-Five Thousand Dollars ($35,000) a year for four years for a total of One Hundred and Forty Thousand Dollars ($140,000).
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. NCA25-16072
Resolution approving a Cooperative Services Agreement between the City of Tampa, Florida and United States Department of Agriculture to provide wildlife damage management services by removing feral swine in the amount of Thirty-Five Thousand Dollars ($35,000) a year for four years for a total of One Hundred and Forty Thousand Dollars ($140,000); authorizing the execution thereof by the Mayor of the City of Tampa; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) Animal and Plant Health Inspection Services - Wildlife Services Program (Program) provides for federal cooperation with local jurisdictions to conduct a program of wildlife removal services involving mammal and bird species that are reservoirs for zoonotic diseases, or animal species that are injurious and/or a nuisance to, among other things, agriculture, horticulture, forestry, animal husbandry, wildlife, and human health and safety.

The USDA and the City of Tampa (City) desire to enter into an Agreement wherein the Program will remove feral swine from lands managed by the City Parks & Recreation Department.

It is the desire of the parties to establish the terms and conditions under which the Program will be implemented.

The cost and expense to the City for the Program will be in the amount of Thirty-Five Thousand Dollars ($35,000) annually for four consecutive years for a total of One Hundred and Forty Thousand Dollars ($140,000).

City Council does hereby affirm that it would be beneficial to the residents of the City to enter into the attached Cooperative Services Agreement between the City and the USDA.

agendaItems.title: File No. NCA25-16111 Resolution approving Contract 25-X-01628 Sulphur Springs Pool Restoration Phase 1 between the City of Tampa and On Track Life Solutions, Inc. for the provision of Sulphur Springs Pool Investigation and Stabilization in the estimated amount of $1,833,700 for use by the Parks and Recreation Department.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. NCA25-16111
Resolution approving Contract 25-X-01628 Sulphur Springs Pool Restoration Phase 1 between the City of Tampa and On Track Life Solutions, Inc. for the provision of Sulphur Springs Pool Investigation and Stabilization in the estimated amount of $1,833,700 for use by the Parks and Recreation Department; authorizing the Mayor to execute said agreement; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
The Parks and Recreation Department has emergency need to contract with On Track Life Solutions, Inc. to investigate and stabilize the Sulphur Springs Pool. Sulphur Springs Pool is being undermined by the adjacent seawall failure through extensive soil exfiltration via large spalling delamination into the river. The Sulphur Springs Pool is a valuable City asset that is currently empty and at risk of further damage without prompt attention and currently poses liability exposure as an attractive nuisance. Due to the proximity of the spring well structure, delays in repairing the site could result in full failure of the pool and shoreline, which could pose a hazard to the well system. The well system serves as a source of water and any disruption to its ability to operate could prevent the city from meeting its obligations with other agencies and lead to environmental and resident service impacts.

On Track Life Solutions Inc., is a city-certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE/BBE) & Small Local Business Enterprise (SLBE).

agendaItems.title: File No. INF25-15784 Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, approving a Fourth Amendment to Master Agreement between the City of Tampa and Timmons Group, Inc., and approving a Second Amendment to Software License and Maintenance Agreement between the City Of Tampa and Azteca Systems, LLC, for the provision of an Asset/Work Management System in the estimated amount of $34,500 for use by the Mobility Department and Water Department; authorizing the Mayor to execute said Amendments.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. INF25-15784
Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, approving a Fourth Amendment to Master Agreement between the City of Tampa and Timmons Group, Inc., and approving a Second Amendment to Software License and Maintenance Agreement between the City Of Tampa and Azteca Systems, LLC, for the provision of an Asset/Work Management System in the estimated amount of $34,500 for use by the Mobility Department and Water Department; authorizing the Mayor to execute said Amendments; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
By authority contained in Resolution No. 2020-811, passed and adopted by City Council on November 19, 2020, the City and Timmons Group, Inc. entered into a Master Agreement for the provision of an Asset/Work Management System for the use by the Mobility Department.

The Timmons Group, Inc. is implementer and consultant for this project and as a platinum partner with Azteca Systems, LLC provides the Cityworks software platform for the City.

By authority contained in Resolution Number 2021-554, passed and adopted by the City Council of the City of Tampa on July 15, 2021, the City of Tampa and Timmons Group, Inc.

entered into a First Amendment to the Master Agreement to change the scope of services to implement two interfaces, one between Cityworks software and the City’s Customer Service Center and the other between Cityworks software and the City’s Oracle Financial System.

By authority contained in Resolution Number 2022-845, passed and adopted by the City Council of the City of Tampa on September 15,2022, the City and Timmons Group, Inc.

entered into a Second Amendment to the Master Agreement to include Change Orders 3 through 5, to add professional services hours for additional configuration needs, increased data transfer capabilities and managed support services and to provide additional training sessions for City staff.

By authority contained in Resolution Number 2023-763, passed and adopted by the City Council of the City of Tampa on August 3, 2023, with the City of Tampa and Timmons Group, Inc. entered into a Third Amendment to the Master Agreement to include Change Order 6 and Addenda 1 thru 4 to add professional services hours for additional configuration needs, increased data transfer capabilities and managed support services and to provide additional training.

The City and Timmons Group, Inc. agree to a Fourth Amendment to the agreement to adjust the Project’s timeline and draw on the contingency to provide professional services for GIS functions.  The City and Azteca Systems, LLC further agrees to a Second Amendment to the agreement to implements Cityworks Enterprise licensing and to procure Trimble Unity Valve Software license to interface with Cityworks and to enhance the Water Department’s Valve program for use by the Water Department.

This award was originally made through the Request for Proposal process. Goals were not prescribed in this agreement; however, it did not preclude participation.

agendaItems.title: File No. INF25-15873 Resolution authorizing an Agreement for Consultant Services in the amount of $2,012,950.94 between the City of Tampa and HNTB Corporation in connection with Contract 24-D-00018, City of Tampa MacDill Air Force Base Access Improvements Project.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. INF25-15873
Resolution authorizing an Agreement for Consultant Services in the amount of $2,012,950.94 between the City of Tampa and HNTB Corporation in connection with Contract 24-D-00018, City of Tampa MacDill Air Force Base Access Improvements Project; authorizing the Mayor of the City of Tampa to execute said Agreement on behalf of the City of Tampa; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
1. Contract Title: City of Tampa MacDill Air Force Base Access Improvements Project a. Number of bidders/submitters:  Three (3) b. Names of bidders/submitters: - Globetrotters Engineering Corporation - HNTB Corporation - Kimley-Horn and Associates, Inc.

c. Dollar amount: $2,012,950.94 d. Why the awardee was selected: Selected Pursuant to FS 287.055 CCNA.

2. Contractor/Firm: HNTB Corporation

3. Business Case: This Agreement provides for professional engineering services for provides for improvements to the Interbay Boulevard Corridor (West Shore Blvd. to Bayshore Blvd.). Project  includes conversion from an existing 2-lane undivided road to a proposed 3- lane divided road west of Dale Mabry Hwy (SR 573), plus wide sidewalks with pedestrian crossings, side street connections, ADA and drainage improvements, bicycle accommodations, and complete pavement resurfacing and restriping. The project design will also incorporate intermittent pavement widening of the roadway to accommodate a center two-way left-turn lane [TWLTL] (or intermittent left-turn pockets) along the corridor from West Shore Blvd. to Dale Mabry Hwy. (SR 573).

4. Equal Business Opportunity (EBO) Statement:  HNTB Corporation, the prime contractor, committed to utilizing five (5) city-certified firms for subcontracting to augment 24.39% of the consultant service agreement (per Form MBD-20, representing SLBE=12.77%, WBE=10.22%, and ABE=1.40%).

5.Sustainability and Resiliency: Project provides for professional engineering services for City of Tampa MacDill Air Force Base Access Improvements Project

6. Community Engagement: The Mobility Department will assist the Firm in the efforts to ensure transparency and integration of the stakeholders.

7. Project: a. Contract delivery method: This is a Design-Bid- Build project. A full-time City of Tampa Construction Inspector will be on-site during the project to ensure quality of construction.

b. Placemaking: N/A c. Time, Quality Assurance, Cost Monitoring (Budget) •  418 consecutive calendar days.

•  The e-Builder project management software system will be utilized to optimize the monitoring of schedules and costs. This software was recently purchased by the City of Tampa and is a premier system for construction project management.

agendaItems.title: File No. INF25-16109 Resolution accepting the proposal of Timm Group Building & General Contractors pertaining to Contract 24-C-00002 E/W Green Spine Cycle Track – PH 2A from Howard Ave to Rome Ave, in the amount of $994,620; authorizing the Mayor of the City of Tampa to execute said contract on behalf of the City of Tampa.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. INF25-16109
Resolution accepting the proposal of Timm Group Building & General Contractors pertaining to Contract 24-C-00002 E/W Green Spine Cycle Track – PH 2A from Howard Ave to Rome Ave, in the amount of $994,620; authorizing the Mayor of the City of Tampa to execute said contract on behalf of the City of Tampa; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
1. Background: a. Contract Title: E/W Green Spine Cycle Track-PH 2A from Howard Ave to Rome Ave b. Number of bidders/submitters: Six (6) c. Names of bidders/submitters: • Timm Group Building & General Contractors • Blacktip Services Incorporated • Burgess Civil, LLC • Ajax Paving Industries of Florida, LLC • Gibbs & Register, Inc.

• David Nelson Construction Co.

d.Dollar amount: $994,620.00 e. Why the awardee was selected: Selected Pursuant to FS 287.055 CCNA.

2. Contractor/Firm: Timm Group Building & General Contractors

3. Business Case:  Provides for the construction of a 2,000 LF two-way urban trail/cycle track along Cass Street from Howard Avenue to Rome Ave. Project also includes Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) sidewalks, ADA ramps, crosswalk upgrades, concrete curb, raised separator, drainage improvements, milling and resurfacing, pavement striping and marking and pedestrian signalization improvement.

4. Equal Business Opportunity (EBO) Statement:   EBO participation totals 0.00% of the FDOT (DBE) aspirational goal.

5. Sustainability and Resiliency: Project provides for a two way urban trail/ cycle track along Cass Street from Howard Ave. to Rome Ave. to enhance the sustainability and resilience of the City.

6. Community Engagement: The CAD Construction, Engineering and Inspection (CAD-CEI) team will assist the Contractor in the communication efforts to ensure transparency and integration of the stakeholders.

7. Project: a. Contract delivery method: This is a Design-Bid- Build project. A full-time City of Tampa Construction Inspector will be on-site during the project to ensure quality of construction.

b. Placemaking: N/A c. Time, Quality Assurance, Cost Monitoring (Budget) •  360 consecutive calendar days.

•  The e-Builder project management software system will be utilized to optimize the monitoring of schedules and costs. This software was recently purchased by the City of Tampa and is a premier system for construction project management.

agendaItems.title: File No. F25-15808 Resolution approving ordering documents US-18531862, CPQ-3807561-1 and CPQ-3597948-1 to expand the existing Annual Subscription of Software as a Service (SaaS) to include a Human Capital Module; to convert the Billing Module for Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) from a Non-Metered Cloud Service to a Universal Credits Model; and for the provision of Continued Mission Critical Support Services under the Public Sector Agreement for Oracle Cloud Services (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540), as amended, between the City of Tampa and Oracle America, Inc. for Oracle Fusion Applications Cloud SaaS Services in the total estimated amount of $139,363.15 for use by the Technology and Innovation Department; authorizing the Mayor to execute said ordering documents.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. F25-15808
Resolution approving ordering documents US-18531862, CPQ-3807561-1 and CPQ-3597948-1 to expand the existing Annual Subscription of Software as a Service (SaaS) to include a Human Capital Module; to convert the Billing Module for Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) from a Non-Metered Cloud Service to a Universal Credits Model; and for the provision of Continued Mission Critical Support Services under the Public Sector Agreement for Oracle Cloud Services (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540), as amended, between the City of Tampa and Oracle America, Inc. for Oracle Fusion Applications Cloud SaaS Services in the total estimated amount of $139,363.15 for use by the Technology and Innovation Department; authorizing the Mayor to execute said ordering documents; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2020-775, passed and adopted by City Council on November 5, 2020, the City of Tampa and Oracle America, Inc. entered into a Public Sector Agreement for Oracle Cloud Services (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540), as amended, between the City of Tampa and Oracle America, Inc. for Oracle Fusion Applications Cloud Saas Implementation Services, which was inclusive of Ordering Documents for the provision of services; and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2021-379, passed and adopted by City Council on May 20, 2021, the City of Tampa and Oracle America, Inc. executed an amendment to the exhibits to Ordering Document US-10220341 and an additional Ordering Document for the provision of services under Oracle Cloud Services Agreement (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540) to allow City of Tampa employees to use third party software hosted by Oracle to report project issues and task assignments, and to provide an additional non- production environment for one year to support data conversion/migration services activities during the Oracle Saas implementation; and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2021-754, passed and adopted by City Council on September 30, 2021, the City of Tampa and Oracle America, Inc. executed Ordering Document/Exhibit Amendment Two to Ordering Document Number US-10220341 and Ordering Document Number US-11308501 for the provision of services for the removal of reports no longer required and the addition of new reports, integrations and new data conversions not originally identified in the original ordering documents and for the provision of additional training services; and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2022-92, passed and adopted by City Council on February 3, 2022, the City executed Ordering Document CPQ-2354275-1 for the provision of a twelve-month online training on various Oracle modules under the Public Sector Agreement for Oracle Cloud Services Agreement (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540); and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2023-406, passed and adopted by City Council on April 20, 2023, the City executed Ordering Document CPQ-2826234-1 for the purchase of an additional twelve-month subscription for online training for the various Oracle modules and additional services under the Oracle Cloud Services Agreement (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540); and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2023-648, passed and adopted by City Council on July 13, 2023, the City executed Ordering Document CPQ-2982734-1-1 for the provision of Two Test Environments for Oracle Fusion Cloud Services under the Public Sector Agreement for Oracle Cloud Services (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540); and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution No. 2024-26, passed and adopted by City Council on January 11, 2024, the City executed Ordering Document US-15383807 to renew annual subscriptions for Oracle Managed Database as a Service and Ordering Document US-15470102 for the renewal of Oracle Mission Support for SaaS under Agreement No. US- CSA-2635540; and Pursuant to the authority contained in Resolution 2024-685, passed and adopted by City Council on August 1, 2024, the City executed Ordering Document US-16782547  to renew the annual subscription Oracle Mission Support for SaaS The City  desire to execute Ordering Document US-16782547 for the renewal of Oracle Mission Critical Support for SAAS.

The City desires to expand the existing annual subscriptions for Software as a Subscription (SaaS) to include a human capital module; to convert the Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) billing model from a non-metered Cloud service to a Universal Credits model; and to renew the Oracle Mission Support for SaaS under Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540.

There was no EBO Participation as this purchase is being made under the Oracle Cloud Services Agreement (Agreement No. US-CSA-2635540).

agendaItems.background:
Pursuant to Resolution 2002-0155, passed and adopted on 2/7/2002, the City entered into an agreement with the Florida Department of Transportation District Seven providing for the mitigation of the Interstate Highway Expansion Project to the Ybor City National Historic Landmark District, the West Tampa National Register Historic District and the Tampa Heights National Register Historic District. agendaItems.title: File No. MAM25-15839 Resolution approving the bid of Moreno Industrial Services Inc. for the furnishing of Vision Zero Rapid Response – Concrete Services (Sheltered Market Solicitation) in the estimated amount of $294,384 over a three-year term for use by the Mobility Department.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. MAM25-15839
Resolution approving the bid of Moreno Industrial Services Inc. for the furnishing of Vision Zero Rapid Response – Concrete Services (Sheltered Market Solicitation) in the estimated amount of $294,384 over a three-year term for use by the Mobility Department; authorizing the Director of Purchasing to purchase said property, supplies, materials or services; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
1. Department or Location of Project: Mobility Department, Transportation Engineering

2. Total number of vendors that accessed and downloaded bid: 1

3. Number and List of bidders: One, Moreno Industrial Services Inc.

4. Award amount: $294,384

5. Why the winning bid was selected: The lowest, responsive, and responsible bidder.

It is recommended that the City award Vision Zero Rapid Response – Concrete Services (Sheltered Market Solicitation) to Moreno Industrial Services Inc. for use by the Mobility Department, Transportation Engineering. The term of the award is for a (3) three-year) term with (1) one additional (2) two-year renewal options. The Department has reviewed and approved the bid response from Moreno Industrial Services Inc. and comments were supplied via Department recommendation letter.

Pursuant to the review by the Equal Business Opportunity (EBO) Division, it was determined that the EBO Sheltered Market Solicitation provision would apply in the bid specifications to the eligible U-WMBE & SLBE firms.

Moreno Industrial Services Inc. is a City Certified Minority Business Enterprise (MBE/HBE) and Small Local Business Enterprise (SLBE).

agendaItems.title: File No. MAM25-16048 Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, supporting Florida house bill 987 which creates the honorary designation of that certain portion of U.S 92/S.R 600/Gandy Boulevard between S. West Shore Boulevard in the City of Tampa, Hillsborough County, Florida, and 4th Street N. in Pinellas county, Florida, as “Senator James A. Sebesta Memorial Highway”.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. MAM25-16048
Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, supporting Florida house bill 987 which creates the honorary designation of that certain portion of U.S 92/S.R 600/Gandy Boulevard between S. West Shore Boulevard in the City of Tampa, Hillsborough County, Florida, and 4th Street N. in Pinellas county, Florida, as “Senator James A. Sebesta Memorial Highway”; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
WHEREAS, in 2025, the Florida Legislature enacted House Bill 987 (Chapter 2025-214, Laws of Florida), which provided for several honorary designations of State of Florida transportation facilities; and pursuant to House Bill 987, the Florida Department of Transportation has been directed to erect suitable markers designating that portion of U.S. 92/S.R. 600/Gandy Boulevard located between S. Westshore Boulevard, City of Tampa, Hillsborough County, and 4th Street N. in Pinellas County with a supporting Resolution from the City Council of the City of Tampa; and Section 334.071, Florida Statutes, requires passage of a resolution by the local governments in support of an honorary designation prior to the erection of markers; and House Bill 987, relating to State of Florida transportation facility designations, has been passed by the Florida Legislature, and which would designate that certain portion of U.S.

92/S.R. 600/Gandy Boulevard located between S. Westshore Boulevard, City of Tampa, Hillsborough County, and 4th Street N. in Pinellas County as “Senator James A. Sebesta Memorial Highway”; and Senator James (“Jim”) Sebesta served as Hillsborough County Supervisor of Elections from 1970 to 1974 and later as a member of the Florida Senate from 1998 to 2006, where he chaired the Transportation Committee; and the City Council of the City of Tampa finds that it is in the best interest of the City to support House Bill 987 which creates the honorary designation of that certain portion of U.S. 92/S.R. 600/Gandy Boulevard located between S. Westshore Boulevard, City of Tampa, Hillsborough County, and 4th Street N. in Pinellas County as “Senator James A. Sebesta Memorial Highway.”

agendaItems.title: File No. HN25-15718 (UNAN; Clendenin absent at vote) ( - An Ordinance of the City of Tampa, Florida, approving the naming of the multisports field at Forest Hills Park in Tampa, Florida, to honor Roland Paz, Sr.; providing an effective date.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. HN25-15718 (UNAN; Clendenin absent at vote)
((Ordinance being presented for first reading consideration) - An Ordinance of the City of Tampa, Florida, approving the naming of the multisports field at Forest Hills Park in Tampa, Florida, to honor Roland Paz, Sr.; providing an effective date. (Original motion to approve said ordinance on first reading was initiated by Viera-Miranda on July 17, 2025)
agendaItems.background:
On November 22, 2023, City Council approved a motion requesting a staff report on the honorary naming of the multisports field at Forest Hills Park in honor of Roland Paz, Sr.  Staff conducted the required due diligence confirming that all requirements, conditions and criteria in Honorary Naming Ordinance 2023-63 are met, culminating in the Honorary Naming Report and subsequent presentation to City Council.  On May 22, 2025, after staff presentation, City Council approved a motion to name the multisports field at Forest Hills Park in honor of Roland Paz, Sr. in recognition of his contribution to the youth and community in Forest Hills.

The City Council presentation was posted to the website on May 23, 2025 for the minimum required 14 days.  Roland Paz, Sr. meets the criteria set out in Ordinance 2023-63, adopted by City Council on May 5, 2023.

Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, relating to the provision of Stormwater Management Services provided by the City's Stormwater Utility; imposing stormwater charges against developed property located in the Stormwater Service area for the Fiscal Year beginning October 1, 2025; approving the Stormwater Roll; directing that the Stormwater Roll be certified to the Hillsborough County Tax Collector; and providing an effective date.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. E2025-8 CH 21
Public hearing to adopt the annual Stormwater Service Assessment within the incorporated boundaries of the City of Tampa for the purpose of paying for the provision of Stormwater Management Services in said area; and the adoption of the annual Non-Ad Valorem Assessment roll to be certified to the Tax Collector to bill for the Non-Ad Valorem Assessment. (Motion adopting resolution to schedule said public hearing initiated by Maniscalco-Hurtak on June 26, 2025)

Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, relating to the provision of Stormwater Management Services provided by the City's Stormwater Utility; imposing stormwater charges against developed property located in the Stormwater Service area for the Fiscal Year beginning October 1, 2025; approving the Stormwater Roll; directing that the Stormwater Roll be certified to the Hillsborough County Tax Collector; and providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background: In accordance with section 403.0893, Florida Statutes, the City Council of the City of Tampa (“City Council”) adopted Ordinance 2003-0200 on August 7, 2003, authorizing and establishing procedures for the imposition and collection of stormwater assessments and stormwater fees to fund the City of Tampa’s (“City”) Stormwater Utility. Section 197.3632, Florida Statutes, provides that prior to the levy of such assessment, the City Council of the City of Tampa must adopt a non-ad valorem assessment roll at a public hearing. Section 21- 129 of the City of Tampa Code requires that City Council adopt an Annual Stormwater Resolution to approve the stormwater assessment roll each fiscal year in which the assessment is charged. Pursuant to section 21-129 of the City of Tampa Code, the City Council shall provide notice and conduct a public hearing prior to the adoption of the Annual Stormwater Resolution. The stormwater rate per Equivalent Stormwater Unit (ESU) for Fiscal Year 2026 is $82. The Stormwater Service Assessments and Stormwater Fees partially fund the City's cost to provide Stormwater Management Services within the incorporated boundaries of the City of Tampa. It is necessary to set a time and date to be able to advertise the public hearing for the City Council to consider the approval of the levy of such assessment and the adoption of an associated assessment roll.

agendaItems.title: File No. E2025-8 CH 21 Public hearing to adopt the Stormwater Capital Improvement Assessment Roll for the Central and Lower Basin Improvement Area within the incorporated boundaries of the City of Tampa for the purpose of paying for the provision of Stormwater Capital Improvement Projects in said area; and the adoption of the Annual Non-Ad Valorem Assessment Roll to be certified to the Tax Collector to bill for the Non-Ad Valorem Assessment.  Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, relating to the construction and funding of stormwater improvements by the City's Stormwater Utility; continuing imposition of Stormwater Improvement Assessments against certain real property within the Central and Lower Basin Improvement area; approving the Stormwater Roll; establishing the lien associated therewith; directing that the Stormwater Roll be certified to the Hillsborough County Tax Collector; and providing an effective date.
agendaItems.rawTitle:
File No. E2025-8 CH 21
Public hearing to adopt the Stormwater Capital Improvement Assessment Roll for the Central and Lower Basin Improvement Area within the incorporated boundaries of the City of Tampa for the purpose of paying for the provision of Stormwater Capital Improvement Projects in said area; and the adoption of the Annual Non-Ad Valorem Assessment Roll to be certified to the Tax Collector to bill for the Non-Ad Valorem Assessment. (Motion adopting resolution to schedule said public hearing initiated by Maniscalco-Hurtak on June 26, 2025)

Resolution of the City of Tampa, Florida, relating to the construction and funding of stormwater improvements by the City's Stormwater Utility; continuing imposition of Stormwater Improvement Assessments against certain real property within the Central and Lower Basin Improvement area; approving the Stormwater Roll; establishing the lien associated therewith; directing that the Stormwater Roll be certified to the Hillsborough County Tax Collector; and providing an effective date.
agendaItems.background:
In accordance with section 403.0893, Florida Statutes, the City Council of the City of Tampa (“City Council”) adopted Ordinance 2003-0200 on August 7, 2003, authorizing and establishing procedures for the imposition and collection of stormwater assessments and stormwater fees to fund the City of Tampa’s (“City”) Stormwater Utility. On July 14, 2016, pursuant to section 21-124 of the City’s Code of Ordinances (“City Code”), City Council adopted Initial Stormwater Resolution No. 2016-567, establishing the Central and Lower Basin Improvement Area. Pursuant to section 21-128 of City Code, City Council adopted Final Stormwater Resolution No. 2016-706 on September 1, 2016, establishing the thirty (30) year Stormwater Improvement Assessment which provides the ability to the City to construct stormwater projects that may otherwise be delayed or not constructed without the assessment. Section 197.3632, Florida Statutes, provides that prior to the levy of such assessments, City Council must adopt a non-ad valorem assessment roll at a public hearing.

Pursuant to section 21-129 of City Code, City Council shall provide notice and conduct a public hearing prior to the adoption of the annual Resolution. The Stormwater Capital Improvement Assessment rate per Equivalent Stormwater Unit (ESU) for Fiscal Year 2026 is $89.55. The Stormwater Capital Improvement Assessment partially funds the City's cost to construct the necessary projects within the Central and Lower Basin Improvement Area of the City by financing the construction and related costs and paying the debt with the proceeds of the Stormwater Capital Improvement Assessments. It is necessary to set a time and date to be able to advertise the public hearing for the City Council to consider the approval of the levy of such assessment and the adoption of an associated assessment roll.
